medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ocular symptoms were noted in some patients; three patients were asymptomatic until identified through imaging. The symptoms varied, including diplopia and visual deterioration, with a mean interval from diagnosis of the primary lesion to ocular metastasis discovery of 4.3 years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of carcinoid tumors in three patients; patient 5 had a previous history of hyperparathyroidism and hypergastrinemia in the context of MEN1 syndrome. Other patients had no prior history suggestive of carcinoid tumors.
medical_history.family_history: Family history of MEN1 in patient 5.
